title: Climate change: Does Germany produce double the UK's carbon emissions?
description: MP John Redwood claims that, on carbon emissions, Germany "puts out twice as much as we do". Is he right?

title: Week in pictures: 7 - 13 August 2021
description: A selection of powerful images taken around the world this week.

title: Nottingham Forest: A celebration of a 'wide, diverse range of fans'
description: Nottingham Forest fans pose for portraits to help others feel welcome at matches.

title: Afghanistan: Journalist Anisa Shaheed refuses to give in to Taliban
description: Anisa Shaheed fears women's freedoms will be curbed again if the Taliban come to power.

title: Skateboarding 'makes me feel like I'm flying', says four-year-old
description: Autumn California Bailey, 4, has 120,000 Instagram followers thanks to her skating videos.

title: Climate change: July world's hottest month ever recorded - US agency
description: US scientists say July's land and ocean temperature was 0.93C (1.68F) above the 20th Century average.

title: Strictly Come Dancing: Ex-rugby star Ugo Monye completes 2021 line-up
description: Ugo Monye will join Olympic swimmer Adam Peaty and 13 other stars when the show returns next month.

title: Cost of NHS Covid tests for UK arrivals reduced
description: Sajid Javid reduces the cost of NHS travel tests ahead of a review into the pricing of all test providers.

title: Will I ever be able to fly without feeling guilty again?
description: More efficient planes and sustainable fuels could lower air travel's impact, but not for a while.

title: A visual guide to what happened
description: A gunman shot and killed five people in Plymouth before turning the gun on himself. Here's what we know about how events unfolded.

title: Incels: A new terror threat to the UK?
description: Is the incel belief system followed by Jake Davison, the Plymouth gunman, a terror threat to the UK?

title: Afghan war: Kabul's young women plead for help as Taliban advance
description: They feel abandoned by the democratic world they thought they were part of, writes Yalda Hakim.

title: Plymouth shooting: Inside the dark world of 'incels'
description: Who are the angry young men who describe themselves as "involuntarily celibate"?

title: Plymouth Shootings: Home Secretary says many questions to be asked
description: Home Secretary Priti Patel says she'll be looking for answers about the shootings that left six dead.

title: Adam Peaty: I'm going to be very uncomfortable on Strictly
description: The Olympic champion is the latest to be announced for the show.

title: 'Hip hip hooray, it's the Burryman's Day'
description: The quirky parade features a man walking through South Queensferry covered from head to ankles in burrs.

title: Plymouth shooting: Jake Davison deadly spree took 6 minutes
description: Jake Davison killed five people, including a young girl, in Plymouth before turning the gun on himself.

title: Van Dijk extends Liverpool contract to 2025
description: Liverpool defender Virgil van Dijk extends his contract with the club until 2025.

title: Afghanistan: Panic and disbelief as thousands flee Taliban onslaught
description: Thousands of Afghans seek refuge in the capital Kabul as the militants seize more key cities.

title: Shooting 'a truly shocking event' say police
description: Devon and Cornwall Police Chief Constable Shaun Sawyer explains how reports of the shootings came in.

title: Car in near-miss with train on Cumbria level crossing
description: CCTV footage shows the car driving across the barrierless crossing in front of the Northern train.

title: Plymouth shooting: Who can own a firearm or shotgun in the UK?
description: A shooting in Plymouth which left six people dead has put the focus on who can own a gun in the UK.

title: Daniela Espirito Santo reported partner to police seven times before death
description: Daniela Espirito Santo, from Grantham, was not failed by police, a watchdog says.

title: Marble Arch Mound: Deputy leader resigns amid spiralling costs
description: Westminster Council's Melvyn Caplan steps down after total costs nearly doubled to £6m.

title: First batch of student's washing machines shipped to Iraq
description: Inspired by a salad spinner, Navjot Sawhney invented the hand-cranked washer four years ago.

title: Tony Bennett: Legendary singer retires from stage aged 95
description: The veteran crooner ends a seven-decade career after a final performance with Lady Gaga last week.

title: Lord of the Rings: Amazon moves show to UK from New Zealand
description: The multi-million dollar production is one of the most expensive shows in the history of television.

title: Plymouth shooting: Forensic investigators at the scene
description: Police cordoned off the area and said that the situation has been contained.

title: Tribute to Manchester Arena bomb survivor found dead aged 20
description: Eve Aston is remembered as "very jolly, sassy, sociable" by her "proud" family.

title: Plymouth shooting: Defence Secretary rules out terrorism
description: Defence Secretary Ben Wallace said the shooting in Plymouth was ''a very sad and tragic event''.

title: James Markham killing: Boy, 14, charged with murder
description: A 14-year-old boy will appear in youth court charged with murdering James Markham.

title: Plymouth MP: Community 'trying to make sense' of shooting
description: MP Luke Pollard says the community is pulling together in the face of the "deeply grim" news.

title: Premier League: 'One signing could decide the title race, but it's not Harry Kane' - Alan Shearer
description: Joining Manchester City would be a brilliant move for Harry Kane - but it would not mean the Premier League title race is all over, says MOTD pundit Alan Shearer.

title: Playing in The Hundred, commentating for the BBC & working for the NHS - Windsor's hectic summer
description: Trent Rockets batter Emily Windsor discusses juggling a career that involves broadcasting, playing cricket and working for the NHS.

title: Coda: 'Deafness is not a costume you can put on,' says film director
description: The maker of the film Coda says being authentic to the story of child with deaf parents was vital.

title: Back to school triggers US fury over masks for students
description: With Covid cases rising, Americans are divided over how students should return to the classroom.

title: Metabolism peaks at age one and tanks after 60, study finds
description: Middle-aged spread cannot be blamed on a waning metabolism, according to researchers.
